user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_file_rewind:
```c
int lfs_file_rewind(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_file_t *file) {
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    LFS_TRACE("lfs_file_rewind(%p, %p)", (void*)lfs, (void*)file);

    err = lfs_file_rewind_(lfs, file);

    LFS_TRACE("lfs_file_rewind -> %d", err);
    LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg);
    return err;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function lfs_file_rewind:
#define LFS_LOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg,0)
...
#define LFS_UNLOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg)
...
#define LFS_TRACE(__VA_ARGS__) 
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No code in the provided lfs_file_rewind function modifies the formal parameters lfs or file. There are no assignments, increments/decrements, or re-bindings of those parameters. The macros used are defined as no-ops that do not perform assignments (LFS_LOCK(cfg) expands to ((void)cfg,0), LFS_UNLOCK(cfg) to ((void)cfg), and LFS_TRACE is empty), so their expansions do not modify the parameter pointers. The call to lfs_file_rewind_(lfs, file) passes the pointers by value — any modifications inside that callee affect only its own parameters, not the caller’s lfs or file variables. Dereferencing lfs (e.g., lfs->cfg) only accesses members and, as shown, is not assigned to. Therefore there are no fragments here that require investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8.
